etymology.description: Pictogram: a footprint pointing up (originally “foot”), later stylized as 龰; oracle forms show three toes and a sole.
etymology.interpretation: A footprint with toes pointing upward represents the foot. The sense broadened from the physical foot to the act of halting one’s step, hence “to stop”; the specific ‘toe’ meaning was preserved in 趾.

examples.chinese: 请立即停止前进(請立即停止前進)。
此处止步，非请勿入(此處止步，非請勿入)。
examples.pinyin: Cǐ chù zhǐbù, fēi qǐng wù rù.
examples.english: Stop here; do not enter without invitation.

examples.chinese: 药到病除，疼痛已止(藥到病除，疼痛已止)。
examples.pinyin: Yào dào bìng chú, téngtòng yǐ zhǐ.
examples.english: With the right medicine, the illness is cured and the pain has stopped.
